    Downloading and organizing a collection of NCBI pathogen genomes

    tutorial_1.Rmd
    library(pdtools)
library(tidyverse)

    Introduction

    https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pathogens is a great resource for accessing publicly available pathogen genomes and their associated metadata. This package,pdtools, provides functions to help organize projects utilizing Pathogen Detection data within R.

    Download metadata from NCBI pathogen detection 

    getwd()
#> [1] "/home/runner/work/pdtools/pdtools/vignettes"
list_organisms() |> kable()

    # create a data directory
dir.create('./data/')

# download them most recent version of the Campylobacter data
dl_res <- download_most_recent_complete(organism = 'Campylobacter', folder_prefix = './data/')
#> [1] "downloading Campylobacter PDG000000003.1591 released 1643729880"
#> [1] "downloading amr data..."
#> [1] "downloading cluster data..."

# two files, [1] = metadata, [2] = SNP clusters (PDS_acc)
list.files('./data/')
#> [1] "PDG000000003.1591.amr.metadata.tsv" "PDG000000003.1591.cluster_list.tsv"

metadata_files <- list.files('./data/', full.names = TRUE, pattern = 'PDG')

# all the information NCBI has about these pathogen isolates/genomes
metadata <- 
  read_tsv(metadata_files[1]) %>% 
  left_join(read_tsv(metadata_files[2]))
#> Rows: 72046 Columns: 66
#> ── Column specification ────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
#> Delimiter: "\t"
#> chr  (51): #label, FDA_lab_id, HHS_region, IFSAC_category, LibraryLayout, PF...
#> dbl  (14): asm_stats_contig_n50, asm_stats_length_bp, asm_stats_n_contig, sp...
#> date  (1): target_creation_date
#> 
#> ℹ Use `spec()` to retrieve the full column specification for this data.
#> ℹ Specify the column types or set `show_col_types = FALSE` to quiet this message.
#> Rows: 59000 Columns: 4
#> ── Column specification ────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
#> Delimiter: "\t"
#> chr (4): PDS_acc, target_acc, biosample_acc, gencoll_acc
#> 
#> ℹ Use `spec()` to retrieve the full column specification for this data.
#> ℹ Specify the column types or set `show_col_types = FALSE` to quiet this message.
#> Joining, by = c("biosample_acc", "target_acc")

dim(metadata)
#> [1] 72046    68

    Clean-up and extract usable information from the metadata 

    
ag_hosts <- extract_consensus_ag_species(metadata)
years <- extract_earliest_year(metadata)
#> Warning in mask$eval_all_mutate(quo): NAs introduced by coercion
countries <- extract_country(metadata)

metadata <- 
  metadata |> 
  left_join(ag_hosts) |> 
  left_join(years) |> 
  left_join(countries)
#> Joining, by = "target_acc"
#> Joining, by = "target_acc"
#> Joining, by = "target_acc"

    Select genomes/isolates of interest 

    
selected_isolates <- 
  metadata |> 
  filter(Year == 2020) |> 
  filter(ag_match %in% c('Swine', 'Human')) |> 
  filter(country == 'USA') |> 
  filter(!is.na(asm_acc))

dim(selected_isolates)
#> [1] 3698   71

    Download genome assemblies for selected isolates 

    # first we need information from genbank giving ftp site paths for assemblies
download_gbk_assembly_summary('./data/assembly_summary.txt')

dir.create('./data/genomes')

download_data <- 
  selected_isolates |>
  select(asm_acc) |> 
  make_ftp_paths(assembly_summary_path = './data/assembly_summary.txt') |> 
  make_download_urls('fna') |> 
  make_dest_paths(type = 'fna', dest_dir = './data/genomes/')
#> Rows: 1098362 Columns: 23
#> ── Column specification ────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
#> Delimiter: "\t"
#> chr  (20): # assembly_accession, bioproject, biosample, wgs_master, refseq_c...
#> dbl   (2): taxid, species_taxid
#> date  (1): seq_rel_date
#> 
#> ℹ Use `spec()` to retrieve the full column specification for this data.
#> ℹ Specify the column types or set `show_col_types = FALSE` to quiet this message.
#> Joining, by = "asm_acc"

download_data
